intro: Spachea membranacea, commonly known as the membranous spachea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves with a delicate, membranous texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along streambanks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
